channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Kalshi raises $1B at $11B valuation, doubling value in under two months
item.description: The latest funding comes less than two months after Kalshi announced that it raised $300 million at a $5 billion valuation.

item.title: Google tests merging AI Overviews with AI Mode
item.description: Google is testing how to make it easier to move from search to an AI chat in a new global test.

item.title: Indiegogo is launching ‘Express Crowdfunding’ so creators can ship things sooner
item.description: Indiegogo is planning to launch a new “Express Crowdfunding” campaign format that lets creators ship things while the campaign is on-going instead of forcing creators to wait until the campaign is over. Indiegogo spokesperson Maciej Kuc tells The Verge that the change was spurred by Indiegogo’s recent move to the infrastructure from its new owner, […]...

item.title: Amazon previews 3 AI agents, including ‘Kiro’ that can code on its own for days
item.description: Amazon Web Services on Tuesday announced three new AI agents it calls "Frontier agents" for coding, security, and DevOps.

item.title: Google is experimentally replacing news headlines with AI clickbait nonsense
item.description: Did you know that BG3 players exploit children? Are you aware that Qi2 slows older Pixels? If we wrote those misleading headlines, readers would rip us a new one - but Google is experimentally beginning to replace the original headlines on stories it serves with AI nonsense like that. I read a lot of my […]

item.title: Original Prusa Core One L 3D printer review
item.description: Prusa's latest 3D printer is the Core One L and, as you guessed, it's a larger version of the highly successful Core One. However, despite the increase in print platform and a few nifty new features, it's only physically 10% larger than the original.

item.title: James Cameron Says ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ Closes the First ‘Avatar’ Saga
item.description: Films four and five, if they even happen, would tell a whole other saga.

item.title: Amazon’s bet that AI benchmarks don’t matter
item.description: This is an excerpt of Sources by Alex Heath, a newsletter about AI and the tech industry, syndicated just for The Verge subscribers once a week. Amazon's AI chief has a message for the model benchmark obsessives: Stop looking at the leaderboards. "I want real-world utility. None of these benchmarks are real," Rohit Prasad, Amazon's […]

item.title: Apple Music Replay 2025 is live ahead of Spotify Wrapped — here’s how to get your recap
item.description: Apple Music Replay 2025 has arrived for subscribers, offering a polished, numbers-focused year-in-review that highlights your top artists, tracks, albums, genres, and playlists.

item.title: Silicon Valley is rallying behind a guy who sucks
item.description: Hello and welcome to Regulator, a newsletter for Verge subscribers that covers the political intrigue and power struggles between Big Tech and Big Government. Subscribe here for a weekly dispatch of tech oligarchs fighting regular oligarchs. Prior to last week, only highly specialized political insiders knew the extent of David Sacks' influence in the Trump […]...

item.title: Don’t Build a PC Right Now. Just Don’t
item.description: PC component prices are really out of control right now.

item.title: Google’s Plan to Win the AI Race Is All About Getting a Little Too Personal
item.description: You've been giving Google the tools it needs for decades.

item.title: ‘The Occupant of the Room’ Wishes You a Very Chilling Christmas
item.description: Shudder’s 'Haunted Season' anthology returns with a spooky new entry directed by series creator Kier-La Janisse.

item.title: FiiO's wired FT13 over-ear headphones offer unique design and an organized sound, they just lack a bit of bite
item.description: If FiiO spots even a slight gap in its product line-up it seems compelled to fill it – and if it can do so while telling an interesting story and adding a bit of visual interest at the same time, that’s even better…

item.title: New data centers will need almost triple the current energy demand by 2035
item.description: Energy use set to skyrocket 300% as AI drives demand.

item.title: Concorde-style air travel could be back soon – these powerful EV motors are unlocking the secrets to supersonic air speeds
item.description: Supersonic air travel could be back on the cards thanks to some very powerful EV motors.

item.title: Do you have to go to your office holiday party?
item.description: Data suggests they’re becoming less common anyway. ‘Tis the season of holiday celebrations with friends, family and, yes—coworkers.

item.title: The future of deep tech will be explained to you at StrictlyVC Palo Alto on Dec 3
item.description: On Wednesday evening at Playground Global in Palo Alto, some very smart people who are building things you don't understand yet will explain what's coming. This is the final StrictlyVC event of 2025, and truly, the lineup is ridiculous.

item.title: Cyber Monday 2025: Live updates on deals still live from Amazon, Apple, Best Buy, Walmart, and more
item.description: Get live updates on Cyber Monday sales after the closing bell. We found last-chance savings of $1,000 on Samsung TVs and record prices on AirPods.

item.title: HBO Max’s ‘Mad Men’ Vomit Scene Proves ‘Remastered’ Doesn’t Mean ‘Better’
item.description: The errors in one of the most beautiful shows ever made continue a modern tradition of reformatting things that are better off left alone.

item.title: 21 Dyson Cyber Week deals you can still shop, plus 1 to avoid at all costs: Save $330 on vacuums, $150 on beauty tools
item.description: Many of the very best Dyson products are still on sale post-Cyber Monday. Save up to 45% on the V12 Detect Slim and grab $150 off Supersonic Nural.
